about_text:
The Oregon Youth Resource Map is a collaboration between Healthy Transitions Youth, youth councils around the state, Direction Service in Eugene, and the Mapping Action Collective in Portland, Oregon. 
 The Resource Map centers youth needs and voices. It focuses on programs, services and leadership opportunities for youth and young adults, ages 16-25 in Oregon, including services for health and mental healthcare, housing, education, and more. The Map began as a way to connect youth with mental health services, and has expanded to include anything that may improve quality of life for youth and young adults. 
 The Oregon Youth Resource Map is funded and contributed to by SAMHSA (Substance Abuse and Mental Health Service Administration), the Oregon Health Authority, Portland State University, Youth ERA, and local service  providers from Douglas and Lane Counties.

contributors.name: Healthy Transitions Transition Age Youth
contributors.description: The idea for the Oregon Youth Resource Map was created by youth, for youth. The Map was first proposed in Youth and Young Adult Voices Comittees, which meet across the state of Oregon. The Healthy Transitions Transition Age Youth team works with and for these youth, to support their voices and continue to develop and support the Map.

contributors.name: Direction Service
contributors.description: Direction Service provides support for disabled children, youth, young adults, and their families in Eugene, Oregon. Direction Service worked closely with Healthy Transitions youth to make the map what it is today.

contributors.name: Mapping Action Collective
contributors.description: The Mapping Action Collective (MAC) uses mapping, data, and technology to support their community and beyond. MAC wrote the code and organized the database that powers the Oregon Youth Resource Map.

contributors.name: Portland State University School of Social Work
Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration (SAMHSA)
contributors.description: The Healthy Transitions SAMHSA Grant funds projects that increase access to mental health support for youth ages 16-25 in Oregon. The Oregon Youth Resource Map is initially funded by SAMHSA.

contributors.name: White Bird Community Services
contributors.description: White Bird maintains the Little Help Book, a mental health resource guide which they generously shared with the Oregon Youth Resource Map.

contributors.name: Street Roots
contributors.description: Street Roots works with and for the houseless community in Portland, Oregon. We thank them for sharing data from their resource guide, the Rose City Resource Guide, with the Oregon Youth Resource Map.
